content.webTitle: Chris Hemsworth to play Hulk Hogan in big-screen biopic

fields.headline: Chris Hemsworth to play Hulk Hogan in big-screen biopic
fields.bodyText: Chris Hemsworth is to take on the role of Hulk Hogan in a new biopic. According to the Hollywood Reporter, the as-yet-untitled film will come from Todd Phillips, director of The Hangover trilogy and the forthcoming DC Comics prequel Joker, starring Joaquin Phoenix. Hemsworth, who will next reprise his role of Thor in Avengers: Endgame, will play the wrestler during his early years and according to sources, the film won’t address his later controversies outside of the ring, including his legal battle with Gawker. The script will come from Scott Silver, whose credits include 8 Mile, The Fighter and Phillips’ foray into the Batman universe. Reportedly a deal is close to being made with Netflix to obtain rights to the film, with Hemsworth and Bradley Cooper also on board as producers. Hogan, born Terry Gene Bollea, will also act as a consultant on the film and an executive producer. His career started in the late 70s in the Florida fighting circuit and by the end of the 80s, he was a worldwide star as part of WWF, now WWE. When Hogan was interviewed in 2013, he expressed interest in Hemsworth playing him. “We need a serious, serious actor that knows what he’s doing,” he said. “You know who I thought would be good? That guy that did that action movie Thor.” As well as his role in the Avengers sequel, Hemsworth will be seen this summer in sci-fi reboot Men in Black: International before starring in the Netflix action drama Dhaka. He was last seen in Bad Times at El Royale. Phillips’ last film as director was 2016’s War Dogs but as producer, he has a credit on A Star is Born alongside Cooper, a longtime collaborator. Joker is set for release later this year, starring Phoenix as the infamous villain in what’s been referred to as a darker, lower-budget character study.
